spexwavepy

Version:

1.0.0

Authors:

Lingfei Hu (DLS), Hongchang Wang (DLS)

Dependencies:

  • Numpy

  • Scipy

  • cv2: This is OpenCV support for python.

  • natsort: This package is used for natural sorting.

E-mail:

lingfei.hu@diamond.ac.uk, hongchang.wang@diamond.ac.uk

What is spexwavepy

Introduction here…

The speckle-based wavefront sensing techniques

Description here…

  • The speckle-based wavefront sensing techniques

    • X-ray Speckle Scanning (XSS) technique with reference beam

    • Self-reference X-ray Speckle Scanning (XSS) technique

    • Conventional X-ray Speckle Tracking (XST) technique with reference beam

    • Self-reference conventional X-ray Speckle Tracking (XST) technique

    • X-ray Speckle Vector Tracking (XSVT) technique

User guide

In this page, we will give a detailed explanation of this python package. All the functions in each module will be covered.

  • User guide

    • Fundamental algorithm

      • Cross-correlation

      • Sub-pixel registration

        • Default method

        • Gaussian peak fitting method

        • Parabola peak fitting method

    • Image match

    • Image stack and its functions

      • Image stack

      • Preprocessing of the images

        • Smoothing

        • Normalization

        • Detector pixel size determination

    • The speckle-based techniques included in Tracking class

      • Stability checking using speckle patterns

      • Reference and sample image stacks collimating before tracking

      • XSS technique with reference beam

      • Self-reference XSS technique

      • XST technique with reference beam

      • Self-reference XST technique

      • XSVT technique

    • Post processing of the tracked speckle pattern shifts

      • Slope reconstruction

      • Local curvature reconstruction

      • 2D integration from the slope
